net.sf.expectit.filter

Class FilterAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.expectit.filter.FilterAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Filter

    public class FilterAdapter
extends Object
implements Filter
    A default filter implementation which does not modify the input.

    Implements functionality for enable/disable the filter. It is intended to be used for creating subclasses.

    • Method Detail

      • beforeAppend

        public final String beforeAppend(String string,
                  StringBuilder buffer)
        Description copied from interface: Filter
        Invoked when a string read from the input is about to be appended to the input buffer. This string is passed as a parameter to this method, and the return value is actually appended.

        Allows to modify the matching input by providing the return value which differs from the given string. The method is invoked on the thread that performs expect operations.

        Specified by:
        beforeAppend in interface Filter
        Parameters:
        string - a chunk of input data read from the input stream. Can not be null. If the filter works in the Filters.chain(Filter...), then the string is the result of preceding filter
        buffer - the reference to the input buffer. Can be used to modify the entire buffer contents.
        Returns:
        the string to be appended to the input buffers, or null to ignore all the consequent filters in the filter chain.

      • doBeforeAppend

        protected String doBeforeAppend(String string,
                    StringBuilder buffer)
        Called if the filter is enabled. Follows the contract of the beforeAppend(String, StringBuilder) method.

        By default returns the given string.

        Parameters:
        string - the input string
        buffer - the input buffer
        Returns:
        the result

      • afterAppend

        public final boolean afterAppend(StringBuilder buffer)
        Description copied from interface: Filter
        Invoked when the input string has just been appended to the input buffer.

        The method is invoked on the thread that performs expect operations.

        Specified by:
        afterAppend in interface Filter
        Parameters:
        buffer - the reference to the input buffer. Can be used to modify the entire buffer contents.
        Returns:
        a boolean flag indicating whether the filtering process should be stopped here. true if all the consequent filters must not be executed, or false otherwise.

      • doAfterAppend

        protected boolean doAfterAppend(StringBuilder buffer)
        Called if the filter is enabled. Follows the contract of the afterAppend(StringBuilder) method.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the input buffer
        Returns:
        the result, the default implementation returns false.

      • isEnabled

        public final boolean isEnabled()
        Description copied from interface: Filter
        Indicates if the filter is enabled or disabled.
        Specified by:
        isEnabled in interface Filter
        Returns:
        true if the filter is enabled, or false otherwise.

      • setEnabled

        public final void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Description copied from interface: Filter
        Enables or disables the filter for the input.

        Allows to switch filter on and off while working with the expect instance.

        Specified by:
        setEnabled in interface Filter
        Parameters:
        enabled - if true then the filter will be enabled, or false otherwise.
